t: Ezekiel 21
Babylon, the Sword of God
And*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem, preach against the holy places, and prophesy against the land of Israel;
and say to the land of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord:*s “Behold, I am*i against you, and I will draw My sword out of its sheath and cut off both righteous and wicked from you.
Because I will cut off both righteous and wicked from you, therefore My sword shall go out of its sheath against all flesh from south to*i north,
that all flesh may know that I, the Lord,*s have drawn My sword out of its sheath; it shall not return anymore.”’
Sigh therefore, son of man, with a breaking heart, and sigh with bitterness before their eyes.

And it shall be when they say to you, ‘Why are you sighing?’ that you shall answer, ‘Because of the news; when it comes, every heart will melt, all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint, and all knees will be weak as*i water. Behold, it is coming and shall be brought to pass,’ says the Lord God.”*s
Again*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord!’*s Say: ‘A*pn sword, a sword is sharpened And*ld also polished!
Sharpened*ld to make a dreadful slaughter, Polished*ld to flash like lightning! Should*ld we then make mirth? It*ld despises the scepter of My son, As*ild it*i does*i all wood.
And*ld He has given it to be polished, That*ld it may be handled; This*ld sword is sharpened, and it is polished To*ld be given into the hand of the slayer.’
“Cry*ln and wail, son of man; For*ld it will be against My people, Against*ld all the princes of Israel. Terrors*ld including the sword will be against My people; Therefore*ld strike your*i thigh.
“Because*ln it*i is*i a testing, And*ld what if the*i sword*i despises even the scepter? The*ild scepter*i shall be no more,”*i says*p the Lord God.*s

“You*pn therefore, son of man, prophesy, And*ld strike your*i hands together. The*ld third time let the sword do double damage.*i It*ld is*i the sword that*i slays, The*ld sword that slays the great men,*i That*ld enters their private chambers.
I*ld have set the point of the sword against all their gates, That*ld the heart may melt and many may stumble. Ah!*ld It*i is*i made bright; It*ild is*i grasped for slaughter:
“Swords*ln at the ready! Thrust*ld right! Set*ld your blade! Thrust*ld left— Wherever*ld your edge is ordered!
“I*ln also will beat My fists together, And*ld I will cause My fury to rest; I,*ld the Lord,*s have spoken.”
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me again, saying:
“And son of man, appoint for yourself two ways for the sword of the king of Babylon to go; both of them shall go from the same land. Make a sign; put it*i at the head of the road to the city.
Appoint a road for the sword to go to Rabbah of the Ammonites, and to Judah, into fortified Jerusalem.
For the king of Babylon stands at the parting of the road, at the fork of the two roads, to use divination: he shakes the arrows, he consults the images, he looks at the liver.

In his right hand is the divination for Jerusalem: to set up battering rams, to call for a slaughter, to lift the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to heap up a siege*i mound, and to build a wall.
And it will be to them like a false divination in the eyes of those who have sworn oaths with them; but he will bring their iniquity to remembrance, that they may be taken.

“Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s ‘Because you have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your doings your sins appear—because you have come to remembrance, you shall be taken in hand.
‘Now*p to you, O profane, wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come, whose iniquity shall*i end,
thus says the Lord God:*s “Remove*pn the turban, and take off the crown; Nothing*ld shall*i remain*i the same. Exalt*ld the humble, and humble the exalted.
Overthrown,*ld overthrown, I*ld will make it overthrown! It*ld shall be no longer,*i Until*ld He comes whose right it is, And*ld I will give it to*i Him.”’
A Sword Against the Ammonites

“And*p you, son of man, prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God*s concerning the Ammonites and concerning their reproach,’ and say: ‘A*pn sword, a sword is*i drawn, Polished*ld for slaughter, For*ld consuming, for flashing—
While*ld they see false visions for you, While*ld they divine a lie to you, To*ld bring you on the necks of the wicked, the slain Whose*ld day has come, Whose*ld iniquity shall*i end.
‘Return*ln it*i to its sheath. I*ld will judge you In*ld the place where you were created, In*ld the land of your nativity.
I*ld will pour out My indignation on you; I*ld will blow against you with the fire of My wrath, And*ld deliver you into the hands of brutal men who*i are*i skillful to destroy.
You*ld shall be fuel for the fire; Your*ld blood shall be in the midst of the land. You*ld shall not be remembered, For*ld I the Lord*s have spoken.’”
